abstract: Such companies, which essentially buy the risks of catastrophe policies sold by traditional insurers, have been looking to consolidate to help compete against new entrants into the industry.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

snippet: Such companies, which essentially buy the risks of catastrophe policies sold by traditional insurers, have been looking to consolidate to help compete against new entrants into the industry.

headline.main: Two Big Reinsurers, PartnerRe and Axis Capital, Merge in $11 Billion Deal
headline.print_headline: Two Big Reinsurers Merge, In Deal Worth $11 Billion
